str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To murder, kill. From phoneus; to be a murderer.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To steal. A primary verb; to filch.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon. From epi and thumos; to set the heart upon, i.e. Long for.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sum up, summarize, recapitulate, gather up in one. From ana and kephalaioo; to sum up.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Near, nearby, a neighbor. Neuter of a derivative of pelas; close by; as noun, a neighbor, i.e. Fellow.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular
